meanings.definition: Engaged in or disposed to engage in warfare or combat
meanings.sent1: The ultramilitant soldiers trained tirelessly for battle.
meanings.sent2: The country faced a threat from an ultramilitant neighboring nation.
meanings.sent3: The ultramilitant ants declared war on the invading beetles.
meanings.sent4: Her ultramilitant dedication to her cause was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The ultramilitant roar of the fighter jets filled the sky.

meanings.definition: Exceeding the usual bounds of militancy or aggression
meanings.sent1: The ultramilitant group's protests turned violent quickly.
meanings.sent2: His ultramilitant behavior made his friends uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The ultramilitant squirrel fiercely defended its acorn stash.
meanings.sent4: The ultramilitant rhetoric of the speech incited the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The ultramilitant response shocked even the seasoned negotiators.

meanings.definition: Characterized by extreme or excessive militancy
meanings.sent1: The ultramilitant leader demanded absolute loyalty from his followers.
meanings.sent2: The ultramilitant approach to negotiations left no room for compromise.
meanings.sent3: The ultramilitant cat pounced on any toy that dared enter its territory.
meanings.sent4: The ultramilitant stance of the government escalated tensions further.
meanings.sent5: The ultramilitant glare in his eyes warned of imminent conflict.
